title: What are some good (sad) songs about loneliness and depression? - Quora

response.answer_text: I first thought of ‘You’ by Keaton Henson, or anything from his recent albums I suppose - but this music video, too, is just artistic to no end.  Or if this is breakup music you’re after, “Sweetheart, What Have You Done To Us”  (The following comes from my experience as a classically versed choral student, but it never fails) To emotionally connect with an audience, let them feel that your volume dynamic is affected by the emotion in your lyrics, tempo, and tone. Let your softs be ‘intimate’ or ‘cathartic’ not ‘quiet’, and your peaks be ‘aggressive’ but not just loud. Bottom line: change your loudness to trail the mood. Keaton Henson lets me hear the white, faulty breaths close to the microphone, the differences between his ‘t’ consonants when he’s out of breath, deliberately exposing his smallest faults as a (fantastic) artist. The best word to describe him is ‘intimate’.
